scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler, Monica, Phoebe, and Joey are there.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Wait a minute, wait. You’re telling me this actress person is the only woman you ever wanted who didn’t want you back?!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah! Oh my God! (to Chandler) Is this what it’s like to be you?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Wow, you’re really crazy about her, huh?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, you have no idea. And-and when we’re on stage I get to-to kiss her and-and touch her, but then she goes home with the director, and it’s like somebody’s ripping out my heart!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, it’s so great to see you feeling like this!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Monica, uh Dad called this morning and ah, Aunt Silvia passed away.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yes!! Yes! Yeah, yeah, yeah!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: We were all pretty shaken up about it.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Wait, am I missing something though? ‘Cause I thought death was something that’s supposed to be sad, in a way.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well ah, Aunt Silvia was, well not a nice person.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, she was a cruel, cranky, old bitch! (Ross gives her a look) (to Ross) And I’m sorry she died. Did Dad say I get the dollhouse?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You get the dollhouse.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I get the dollhouse!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Wow, a house for dolls, that is so cool! When I was kid, I had a barrel.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Uh, Pheebs, you had a barrel for a dollhouse?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, just a barrel.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Y'know what, you can play with my dollhouse.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Really?! Really?!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Any time you want. Y'know, when I was younger, all I wanted to do was to play with this dollhouse, but no!! It was to be looked at, but never played with.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: My Grandmother used to say that exact same thing to me.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler, Monica, Phoebe, and Joey are there.]

events.event_description: Chandler questions Joey about his feelings for an actress who doesn't reciprocate.
Joey expresses his emotional pain over his unrequited love for the actress.
Monica comments on Joey's feelings and his experience on stage with the actress.
Phoebe reacts positively to Joey's feelings and his stage experience.
Ross enters and informs the group about Aunt Silvia's passing.
Monica reacts with excitement and questions about inheriting a dollhouse after Aunt Silvia's death.
Ross confirms that Monica will receive the dollhouse.
Phoebe expresses her admiration for a dollhouse and mentions her childhood barrel.
Monica offers her dollhouse to Phoebe for play.
Monica reflects on her childhood desire to play with her dollhouse and her frustration at it being only for display.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Rachel’s office, Chandler and her are coming back from lunch.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey, Sophie!

dialogue.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: Hey, Rach!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Thanks for lunch, Chandler. Y'know, you didn’t have to walk me all the way back up here.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, that’s-that’s okay, no problem. (He starts to look around her office.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Honey um, honey, you do realise that we don’t keep the women’s lingerie here in the office?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, I realise that.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Summer catalogue! (hands him the catalogue)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That’s the stuff! (quickly grabs it)

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: Rachel, I need the Versachi invoice. (to Chandler) Hello! You don’t work for me.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (introduces them) Joanna, this is my friend Chandler Bing (to Chandler) Joanna.

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: Bing! That’s a great name.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Thanks, it’s ah, Gaelic, for ‘Thy turkey’s done.’ So ah, I’m gonna go, nice, nice meeting you.

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: Me too.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Bye, Chandler.

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: (to Rachel) So ah, what’s wrong with him?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, nothing, he’s just goofy like that, I actually, hardly notice it anymore.

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: Oh no, no-no-no, is he ah, married, or involved with anyone?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No!! No! He’s not married, or involved, with anyone!

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: Oh, Rachel, (pause) actually, y'know what, forget it.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, I’ll ask him for you, if you want me too?

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: Would you? Or, is it just to sad and desperate, and y'know something that Sophie would do?

dialogue.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: Uh, uh, uh, I am here.

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: I know that.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Rachel’s office, Chandler and her are coming back from lunch.]

events.event_description: Chandler and Rachel return to her office after lunch.
Rachel greets Sophie upon entering her office.
Chandler greets Sophie and Rachel.
Rachel thanks Chandler for lunch and comments on him walking her back.
Chandler responds that it's no problem and looks around Rachel's office.
Rachel points out that the office doesn't keep women's lingerie, handing Chandler a summer catalogue.
Chandler quickly grabs the catalogue after Rachel hands it to him.
Joanna asks Chandler for the Versace invoice and comments that he doesn't work for her.
Rachel introduces Chandler to Joanna and mentions his name.
Joanna comments that Chandler's name is great, and Chandler makes a joke about its Gaelic origin.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is showing off her new dollhouse. It’s a huge
dollhouse, that takes up the entire living room table.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Look at it! Ohhh! Wallpaper’s a little faded, that’s okay. Carpet’s a little loose. Hardwood floors!!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hello.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh! Ooh! Oh Monica! It’s so beautiful.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I know!!!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: So, I’m here, ready to play.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I brought a bunch of stuff for the house, so check it out. Ha-ha. (She removes this large ceramic dog that comes up to the second floor and places it next to the house.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What’s this?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: That’s a dog, every house should have a dog.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Not one that can pee on the roof.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, maybe it’s so big because the house was built on radioactive waste.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (holding a tissue) And is this in case the house sneezes?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, no, that’s the ghost for the attic.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I don’t want a ghost.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, nobody wants a ghost. But you’ve got one, because the house is sitting on an ancient Indian burial ground.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Wait a minute, the house was built on radioactive waste, and an ancient Indian burial ground? That would never happen.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, obviously you don’t know much about the U.S. government.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hello.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I need to talk to you!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Sure, what’s up?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, sorry. I meant Chandler.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I-I know. Well if something comes up... (walks away)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, I'm glad you guys are past that little awkward phase.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, my boss, Joanna, when you left, she started asking questions about you...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh-ho, liked what she saw, huh? Dug my action, did she? Checkin’ out the Chan-Chan man!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (looks at him) That was (pause) surreal. Okay, what do think? Are you interested at all?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, she seemed cool, attractive. I’ll do it.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh thank you, Chandler, this is so great, she’s gonna love me.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (holding a dinosaur) Okay, dinosaur attack!! Quick, everybody into the house!! Ahh-ahh! (the dinosaur starts attacking the house. She starts to bark like a dog.) Roof! Rrroof-roof-roof!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, Phoebe, y'know what? That-that’s it, that’s it, all right? No dinosaurs, no ghosts, no giant dogs, okay? They’re not the right size, they’re not Victorian, and they just don’t go.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, (starts to pack up her stuff) fine. Come dinosaur, we’re not welcome in the house of no imagination.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Uh, Pheebs, while we’re hovering around the subject. I just have to say dinosaurs, they-they don’t go, rrroof!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: The little ones do.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is showing off her new dollhouse. It’s a huge
dollhouse, that takes up the entire living room table.]

events.event_description: Monica shows off her new dollhouse, commenting on its features and condition.
Phoebe enters and compliments Monica on the dollhouse.
Phoebe introduces her decorative ceramic dog to Monica and questions its size and purpose.
Phoebe claims the house is built on radioactive waste, explaining the large ceramic dog.
Chandler sarcastically questions the purpose of a tissue in relation to the dollhouse.
Phoebe explains the tissue is for a ghost in the attic of the dollhouse.
Monica expresses her dislike for ghosts in her dollhouse.
Phoebe claims the dollhouse is sitting on an ancient Indian burial ground, implying a ghost presence.
Rachel enters and announces she needs to talk to Chandler, prompting Ross to walk away.
Phoebe pretends to attack the dollhouse with a dinosaur toy, barking and making dinosaur sounds.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Theatre, Joey and Kate are getting ready to rehearse the play.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, Kate!

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Morning.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Listen, I ah, went to that restaurant that you were talking about last week...

dialogue.speaker: THE DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: Hey, lovely! Come, talk to me a minute! (she goes over to him)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (to himself) And I ate the food, I had the fish, it was good, yeah. It was good, yeah...

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: Hi, oh, I’m Lauren, Kate’s understudy.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, hey! Joey Tribbiani.

dialogue.speaker: LAUREN
dialogue.text: I know! I-I’m a big fan of yours.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (looks at her, shocked) What?!

dialogue.speaker: LAUREN
dialogue.text: I used to umm, schedule my classes so I could watch Dr. Drake Remoray on Days of Our Lives .

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Get out of here, really?!

dialogue.speaker: LAUREN
dialogue.text: Absolutely!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: LAUREN
dialogue.text: Oh but then, they went and dropped you down that elevator shaft.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: They gave me the shaft all right.

dialogue.speaker: LAUREN
dialogue.text: (laughing) Oh, you’re so funny. Listen, umm, what are you doing after rehearsals? Do you want to get a drink, or something?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well Ahh, (he sees Kate and the director kissing) yeah! Yeah, sure, a drink sounds great.

dialogue.speaker: LAUREN
dialogue.text: Cool! I-I’ll see you then.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right.

dialogue.speaker: THE DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: All right, it’s time to act, my talking props. (Both Joey and Kate just look at each other.)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: The Theatre, Joey and Kate are getting ready to rehearse the play.]

events.event_description: Joey greets Kate and mentions going to a restaurant she talked about last week.
The Director calls Joey and Kate over to talk to her.
Joey internally reflects on eating fish at the restaurant he visited.
Lauren introduces herself to Joey as Kate's understudy and expresses her admiration for Joey.
Lauren reveals she used to watch Joey on Days of Our Lives and scheduled her classes to do so.
Lauren jokes about Joey being dropped down an elevator shaft in the show.
Lauren asks Joey if he wants to get a drink after rehearsals.
Joey notices Kate and the Director kissing and agrees to have a drink with Lauren.
Lauren confirms she will see Joey after rehearsals for a drink.
The Director announces it's time to act, prompting Joey and Kate to look at each other.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is entering with her own dollhouse, that she made
herself.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Look everybody, look at my new dollhouse!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Wow!!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Look, look! (She lifts up the roof, and the front panel falls revealing the interior.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, what’s this?!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, okay, it’s the slide instead of stairs. Watch this. (She slides a doll down the slide)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It’s very interesting, Phoebe.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What’s this?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: The Licorice Room, you can eat all the furniture. And, when guests come over, they can stay on the tootsie roll-away bed.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: This is the coolest house ever!!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey, does anybody want to join me in the aroma room? (lights some incense)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: All right!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I would!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey, guys, guys, did you see my new, china cabinet?!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS AND RACHEL
dialogue.text: Uh-huh.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Watch, watch. (She turns a strand of Christmas lights strung around the house.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS AND RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ooohhhh!!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: And, and! (She turns on a bubble maker.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS AND RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ahhhh!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey, my Father’s house does that!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (to Chandler) O-o-o-okay, how did it go? Tell me everything.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, the movie was great, dinner was great, and there’s nothing like a cool, crisp New York evening.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hmm.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Of course, I didn’t get to enjoy any of that, because Joanna’s such a big, dull dud !

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is entering with her own dollhouse, that she made
herself.]

events.event_description: Phoebe enters Monica and Rachel's apartment carrying her handmade dollhouse.
Phoebe announces her new dollhouse to the group.
Phoebe lifts the roof of her dollhouse, causing the front panel to fall and reveal the interior.
Ross questions Phoebe about a feature of the dollhouse.
Phoebe demonstrates the slide feature of her dollhouse by sliding a doll down it.
Monica shows her new china cabinet to the group.
Phoebe turns on a strand of Christmas lights around her dollhouse.
Phoebe activates a bubble maker to create bubbles around her dollhouse.
Chandler enters the apartment and comments that his father's house has a similar feature.
Rachel asks Chandler to tell her about his day, and Chandler describes his evening including a movie and dinner.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Rachel’s office, Joanna’s telling Rachel, her side of the story.]

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: Chandler is fantastic!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?!

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: Oh God, we just clicked! Y’know how people just click? Like he came by to pick me up, and I opened the door, and it was just like, click! Did he tell you?

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: Oh, and he’s got such a good heart! Doesn’t he have a good heart?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, I know...

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: Oh, I know and he’s soo sweet! Listen, he said he was going to call, so put him straight through.

dialogue.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: Isn’t this great?!

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: Don’t spoil it.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Rachel’s office, Joanna’s telling Rachel, her side of the story.]

events.event_description: Joanna exclaims that Chandler is fantastic.
Rachel reacts with surprise to Joanna's statement about Chandler.
Joanna describes how she and Chandler clicked when he came to pick her up.
Joanna asks Rachel if Chandler told her about their interaction.
Rachel expresses uncertainty or hesitation in response to Joanna's statement.
Joanna praises Chandler's good heart and sweetness.
Joanna instructs Rachel to put Chandler through because he said he would call.
Sophie comments on the situation, expressing excitement.
Joanna warns Sophie not to spoil the moment.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Theatre, Joey and Kate are rehearsing.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Come on baby, don’t go. Please? What do you say?

dialogue.speaker: THE DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: (answering the phone) Hello. Oh! It’s you. Just ah, just one-one sec. (to Joey and Kate) I am going to take this call. When I continue, I hope that there will appear on stage this magical thing that in the theatre we call, committing to the moment ! (He goes to take the call.)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (to Kate) That guy’s like a cartoon. What do you see in him anyway?

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: He happens to be brilliant. Which is more than I can say for that sweater you’re dating.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, I’m not interested in her sweater! It’s what’s underneath her sweater that counts. And besides, since ah, since when do you care who I’m going out with?

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: I don’t care. Why, do you want me to care?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Do you want me to want you to care?

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Do you?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: THE DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: (returning) Okay, I’m afraid to say this, but let’s pick it up where we left off.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Come on baby, don’t go. Please? What do you say?

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: I’ve got no reason to stay.

dialogue.speaker: THE DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: Stop!! Stop it! You must stop! You are bad actors! This is a terrible play! I’ll see you in the morning. (exits)

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: I can’t believe we go on in, in a week.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, it’s gonna be all right.

dialogue.speaker: LAUREN
dialogue.text: (to Joey) Hey! So since we’re getting off early, do you want to go and paint mugs?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: LAUREN
dialogue.text: You know! At the place I told you about last night?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah, with the mug painting. Yeah. I was so listening to that. But ah, y'know what, I think I kinda need to work on my stuff tonight.

dialogue.speaker: LAUREN
dialogue.text: Oh, okay.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Okay. (he gives her a peck on the cheek)

dialogue.speaker: LAUREN
dialogue.text: I’ll see you tomorrow. (she kisses him full on the mouth.)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: LAUREN
dialogue.text: G’night. (exits)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (to Kate) Ah, are you okay?

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Yeah, I guess. Look, what are we gonna do about this scene, huh?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I don’t know.

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Well umm, maybe if it had more heat.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: How do you mean?

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Well, Adrian’s looking for a reason to stay, right? Victor can’t just kiss her, he’s gotta, gotta really give her a reason, y'know?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Maybe he could slip her the tongue.

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Or maybe, maybe he could grab her, and, and, and, and lift her up.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah, and then Adrian, she maybe she could wrap her legs around his waist.

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: And then she could rip off his shirt and kiss his chest, and, and his stomach!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: And then, then he could use his teeth, his teeth to undo her dress, and, and, and bite her!

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: And then right, right when the scene ends, he could take her with this raw, animal....

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Something like that?

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Yeah, that’s pretty much what I had in mind.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: The Theatre, Joey and Kate are rehearsing.]

events.event_description: Joey pleads with Kate to stay, saying 'Come on baby, don’t go. Please?'
The Director answers a phone call and announces he will take a break to answer it
The Director leaves to take the phone call, indicating a desire to 'commit to the moment' in the scene
Joey comments that the Director is like a cartoon and questions Kate about her interest in him
Kate defends the Director, saying he is brilliant, and makes a sarcastic remark about Joey's girlfriend's sweater
Joey responds that he's not interested in the girlfriend's sweater, but in what's underneath, and questions Kate about her concern for his dating choices
Joey and Kate engage in a flirtatious exchange about caring and wanting each other to care
The Director returns and urges them to continue their scene, indicating a desire to resume rehearsal
Joey repeats his plea for Kate to stay, saying 'Come on baby, don’t go. Please?'
Kate states she has no reason to stay, indicating her decision to leave the scene

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross and Monica are eating breakfast as Joey enters, very
happily.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (to Ross) Hey.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (to Monica) Hey.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: It’s a little early to be drinkin’.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No-no, things ah, finally happened with Kate.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ohhhhh!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You’re kidding?! That’s great!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, it was so amazing. After the (pause) love making...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yep. I just, I just watched her sleep for like hours, just breathing in and breathing out. And then I knew she was dreaming ‘cause, ‘cause her eyes keep going like this. (He closes his eyes and moves them around, kinda like he’s been processed by the devil, or something.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (entering with Rachel) I’m telling ya, Joanna’s got it all wrong. Okay? All I said was, ‘This was fun. Let’s do it again sometime. I’ll give you a call.’

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ohh, gee. I wonder why she thinks you’re going to call her?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That’s what you say at the end of a date.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You can’t just say, ‘Nice to meet you, good night?’

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: To her face? Look it’s the end of the date, I’m standing there, I know all she’s waiting for is for me to say ‘I’ll call her’ and it’s just y'know, comes out. I can’t help it, it’s a compulsion.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Come on Rach, when a guy says he’s going to call, it doesn’t mean he’s going to call. Hasn’t it ever happened to you?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, they always called.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hmm, bite me.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross and Monica are eating breakfast as Joey enters, very
happily.]

events.event_description: Joey enters Monica and Rachel's apartment and greets Ross and Monica.
Joey announces to Ross that things finally happened with Kate.
Joey describes watching Kate sleep and her eyes moving, indicating she was dreaming.
Chandler and Rachel enter the scene and discuss Chandler's interaction with Joanna.
Chandler explains to Rachel that he told Joanna he would call her again after their date.
Rachel questions Chandler about why Joanna might think he will call her.
Chandler admits to Rachel that he has a compulsive tendency to say he will call after a date.
Monica comments to Rachel that when a guy says he'll call, it doesn't necessarily mean he will.
Monica sarcastically tells Rachel to 'bite me' after her comment about calling.

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: (entering) Did he call?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No. Sorry.

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: Why?! Why?! He said he’d call. Why hasn’t he called?

dialogue.speaker: SOPHIE
dialogue.text: Maybe he’s intimated by really smart, strong, successful women.

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: Sophie, would you please climb out of my butt. Why hasn’t he called, Rachel? Why?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, okay. Umm, well ah, maybe he, maybe he feels awkward because you are my boss.

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: Awkward? Why should he feel awkward?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well...

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: The only person that should feel awkward is you, and you didn’t tell him not to call me, did you?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No. I...

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: Because if you feel uncomfortable with your friend dating someone you work for, there are always ways to fix...that.

events.event_description: Joanna enters Rachel's office and asks if he called.
Rachel responds that he did not call and apologizes.
Joanna expresses frustration and questions why he hasn't called.
Sophie makes a sarcastic remark suggesting he might be intimidated by successful women.
Joanna asks Rachel why he hasn't called, expressing urgency.
Rachel speculates that he might feel awkward because Joanna is her boss.
Joanna questions why he should feel awkward and confronts Rachel about not telling him not to call her.
Rachel admits she did not tell him not to call Joanna.
Joanna suggests that if Rachel feels uncomfortable about her friend dating her boss, there are ways to fix the situation.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Chandler is reading a magazine as Rachel approaches.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (grabbing the magazine out of his hands) Call her! Call her now!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Multiple, so many paper cuts.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Why hasn’t he called Rachel? Why? Why? I don’t understand. Why? He said he’ll call. Why? Why? Chandler I’m telling you she has flipped out, she’s gone crazy!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (sarcastic) Oh, well give me the phone then.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Come on, this isn’t funny. She thinks it’s my fault that you haven’t called her. You have to call her!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Look, you can’t call somebody after this long just to say, ‘In case you didn’t notice, I don’t like you!’

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well then you’re going to have to take her out again.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Nooo!! She’s really dull! And she gets this gross mascara goop thing in the corner of her eye!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I don’t care! I don’t care! You are going to have to take her out again and end it, and end it in way that she knows it’s actually ended. And, I don’t care how hard it is for you, do not tell her that you will call her again!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: All right! Fine! But it’s just a lunch date, no more than an hour! And from now on I get my own dates, I don’t want you setting me up with anybody ever again!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: That’s fine!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That’s just a lot of big talk, y'know.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I know.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Chandler is reading a magazine as Rachel approaches.]

events.event_description: Rachel approaches Chandler and grabs the magazine out of his hands.
Rachel demands Chandler to call her now.
Chandler comments on having multiple paper cuts from reading the magazine.
Rachel questions why the person hasn't called her and expresses her frustration.
Chandler sarcastically suggests Rachel should give him the phone.
Rachel insists Chandler must call the person who has not called her, implying she has flipped out.
Chandler refuses to call someone after a long time, saying he would say he doesn't like her.
Rachel insists Chandler should take the person out again and end the relationship clearly.
Rachel orders Chandler not to tell the person he will call her again.
Chandler agrees to take the person out again for a lunch date and asserts he will have his own dates in the future.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is entering.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Mon?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (from the bathroom) I’m in the shower!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, fire! There, there’s a fire! Fire!!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is entering.]

events.event_description: Ross enters Monica and Rachel's apartment.
Ross calls out to Monica, asking if she's there.
Monica responds from the bathroom that she is in the shower.
Ross exclaims 'Oh, fire!' indicating he perceives a fire or emergency.
Ross shouts 'There, there’s a fire! Fire!!' to alert Monica or others.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Theatre, Kate is arriving for rehearsal.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: So I ah, talked to Lauren, kinda told her how things were with us. Did you ah, did you talk to Marshall?

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: About what?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Y'know, about what happened with us.

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Nooo. And there’s really no reason he should find out, so ah let’s not make a big deal about it, okay?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What are you talking about? It was a big deal. I mean, come on you can’t tell me last night didn’t mean something to you. I-I was there, you’re not that good an actress.

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Look umm, I, I was, I was just caught up in the moment. That’s all it was. Joey, I’m-I’m sorry you feel bad, but haven’t you ever sleep with a women where it meant more to her than it did to you?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Nooo.

dialogue.speaker: LAUREN
dialogue.text: (entering) Hi, Kate!

dialogue.speaker: KATE
dialogue.text: Hi, Lauren.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hi, Lauren.

dialogue.speaker: LAUREN
dialogue.text: Hi, pig!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: The Theatre, Kate is arriving for rehearsal.]

events.event_description: Joey greets Kate with 'Hey' upon her arrival at the theatre.
Joey tells Kate that he talked to Lauren about their relationship.
Joey asks Kate if she talked to Marshall about what happened between them.
Kate responds that she has not talked to Marshall and suggests they keep their situation private.
Joey insists that their encounter was significant and questions Kate about her feelings.
Kate explains that she was caught up in the moment and apologizes for Joey's feelings.
Kate questions whether Joey has ever slept with a woman when it meant more to her than to him.
Lauren enters the scene and greets Kate and Joey.
Lauren greets Kate with 'Hi, Lauren' and Joey with 'Hi, Lauren'.
Lauren calls Kate 'Hi, pig!'

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Ross are inspecting the damage to the
dollhouse.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Sorry I ah, I scared you in there.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, that’s okay. By the way, I was just checking the shower massager.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (runs over to her) I tried to reach you at work. There’s....been a fire.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What?! Oh my... (sees the remains of the house) Oh my God!! What happened?!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, we believe it originated here. (He uses a pointer and points to the point of origin.) In the Aroma Room.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: All right. Did everyone get out okay?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, the giraffe’s okay. And so is the pirate.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ohh. What is this? (She sees a tissue covering something, and moves to remove it.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No Phoebe, don’t look! You don’t want to see what’s under there!!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (She pauses to ready herself, and removes the tissue.) Ohh, the-the Foster puppets!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Ross are inspecting the damage to the
dollhouse.]

events.event_description: Ross apologizes to Monica for scaring her in the dollhouse.
Monica checks the shower massager.
Phoebe enters the scene and greets Monica.
Monica informs Phoebe about the fire at her apartment.
Ross indicates the fire originated in the Aroma Room using a pointer.
Monica reports that the giraffe and pirate dolls are unharmed.
Phoebe notices a tissue covering something and moves to remove it.
Ross warns Phoebe not to look under the tissue.
Phoebe pauses and then removes the tissue to reveal the Foster puppets.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Rachel’s office, Chandler and Joanna are returning from their lunch date.
He is telling her about her mascara problem. Rachel is already there.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: It’s not a big deal. It’s, just it’s right here, (points to his eye) and it’s all the time.

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: Well, thanks again for lunch.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (He looks over at Rachel, who nods her head) Yes, this, this was pleasant.

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: It was, wasn’t it?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: The food there was, was great.

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: Wasn’t it?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So take care.

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: You too.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, this was great. I’ll give you a call. We should do it again sometime. (Rachel is disappointed)

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: Great! I’m looking forward to it. Rachel, any messages?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Sophie’s desk.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (whispering) Chandler!! Are you gonna call her!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Noo!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Chandler!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Look, I’m sorry. Okay? I’m weak, and pathetic, and sorry.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, you are going to tell her and you’re going to tell her now. (She grabs his nipple and starts to twist it.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ahhhh—I’m not going to call you.

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I’m sorry. I’m-I’m-I’m sorry that I said I was going to when I’m not. Look, this has nothing to do with you, y'know? And this isn’t Rachel’s fault. It’s me. I have serious, serious problems when it comes to women. I have issues with commitment, intimacy, (pause) mascara goop. And I’m really sorry, it’s just that this is not, this isn’t going to work out.

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: Well, this isn’t how I was hoping how this would end, but I guess I have to appreciate your honesty.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, o-okay.

dialogue.speaker: JOANNA
dialogue.text: So...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well this is great! I’ll give you a call! We should do it again sometime!

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Rachel’s office, Chandler and Joanna are returning from their lunch date.
He is telling her about her mascara problem. Rachel is already there.]

events.event_description: Chandler points to his eye and explains that his mascara problem is ongoing.
Joanna thanks Chandler for lunch.
Chandler looks at Rachel and nods, indicating the lunch was pleasant.
Joanna confirms that she enjoyed the lunch.
Chandler comments that the food was great.
Joanna agrees that the food was good.
Rachel asks if Chandler will call Sophie, whispering to him.
Rachel grabs Chandler's nipple and twists it to force him to admit he won't call Sophie.
Chandler apologizes and admits he has serious issues with women and cannot continue the relationship.
Joanna expresses disappointment but appreciates Chandler's honesty about ending the relationship.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is talking on the phone.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (on phone) Well, so anyway Beth, what I’m saying is I should’ve considered your feelings before I went home with you that night. I’ve ah, I’ve recently learned what’s it like to be on your side of it, and I’m sorry. So, do you think you can forgive me? (listens) Great. Thanks. Okay, bye. (He sits down and crosses out something, and dials the phone again.) Hello, Jennifer? (listens) Oh hi, Mrs. Loreo, is Jennifer there? (listens) Oh, she’s not home huh? (listens) Well ah, actually I kinda need to talk to you too.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is talking on the phone.]

events.event_description: Joey makes a phone call to Beth, expressing regret for going home with her and asking for forgiveness.
Joey listens to Beth's response on the phone.
Joey thanks Beth and ends the call.
Joey crosses out something on a piece of paper.
Joey dials the phone again to call Jennifer.
Joey asks to speak to Jennifer on the phone.
Joey listens to Mrs. Loreo on the phone, inquiring about Jennifer's whereabouts.
Joey expresses that he needs to talk to Mrs. Loreo as well.
